Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Joan Ravnkilde L
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this small hotel gave us an unrivalled vacation. The staff was very service minded and assisted us in every single arrangement we were asking for and with a smile on their lips. The location was in the middle of Venice just a stone's throw from Piazza San Marco. We can recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to have a romatic stay in Venice. Lillie, Denmark.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely in a great location”
Reviews.Author: pongotravels
Reviews.Content: Lovely old venetian hotel. Well worth paying the extra for canal view.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a four star hotel ! Maybe two or three! No real suites!”
Reviews.Author: madhupchaurasia
Reviews.Content: The hotel has no real lobby, nor even a place to sit outside your room! The room is kind of a contorted , made up idea of a 'suite' just because a desk and a round table with two chairs are placed in the smallish room. It has a largish bed with old hardened mattress, non maintained bathroom fittings such as a broken shower which scalded me, and nothing to help ventilation when the air-conditioning is not working! We were simply told very curtly, 'nothing can be done about it ' when we spent sleepless nights due to the room being extremely stuffy. Food is 'served' in the roadside restaurant next to the hotel where you have the pleasure to be nudged by pedestrians! Room service is negilgible. If this is a four star, probably all hotels in the area are five or more stars! Stay away from it!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nan555
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by a very friendly and helpful person at the front desk. I wish I had gotten his name because he was really exceptional. We got there in the late morning before their normal check-in time but had only a short wait until our room was ready. The location of this hotel is unbeatable. You are around the corner from St. Mark's Square. There is a nice breakfast buffet across the street at their sister hotel, the Dona Palace. My favorite part of the room would have to be the jetted shower. Once I figured out the controls, it was awesome. The only complaint we had was that the bed could have been more comfortable. But even saying that, I would still stay here again if I were fortunate enough to ever get to return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great View!!!!”
Reviews.Author: yupoarist
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 6 times and still enjoy it. The location is perfect, tucked behind San Marco, with a great view of the Bridge of Sighs (Ponte dei Sospiri). All the rooms are junior suites, and it is worth the extra price to choose a canal view room. My husband watches all the boats that go up and down the canal, while I get dressed..............it is fun!!!! Each of the rooms is very large, as it is an old Palazzo. They are decorated in typical old Venetian style with canopy beds, wooden beams, fabric on the walls and huge Murano glass chandeliers. The breakfast room is in a "sister" hotel, just a few feet away. The breakfast was quite good, with the normal breads, cereals, yogurts, fruit, but also some very nice cakes, typical of Venice. The people at the reception desk were all very friendly and very helpful. They gave us tips on places to eat and looked up information for us on various exhibitions they weren't familiar with. This is a small hotel that does not have a lobby as such, where you can sit and read, so if that is what you are looking for, this may not be the hotel for you. Considering its location I feel the price is very fair. I do think that management needs to check the rooms more carefully, as there were a few deficiencies. There was a lightbulb out in the large chandelier, as well as in the bathroom. Europeans tend to have darker rooms than Americans are used to, so burned out lightbulbs make a big difference. Some of the furniture needs to be replaced, as it is just tired. The small couch was difficult to sit on, as the cushions sank very low. These are all minor items, but I think the rooms need to be refreshed to keep up with other similar hotels that have been refreshed. That being said, we will definitely return to this hotel, as it is the experience that we are looking for. I just want to be upfront, so that others looking for a different experience will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice room but...”
Reviews.Author: Leopoldo H
Reviews.Content: Ill been there three nigts. The hotel is great located just some feets from San Marco. The room was clean and the room service was very good too (we took all breakfast at room and was good and on time). But....... they still have an isue with Hot Water, most of the time is just a narrow amount of it, enoght to not take a absolutlu cold shower (forget a good shave) and sometime not hot water at all. The people at front desk have no experience. They try to solve any inconvinient but do not know how.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT ROOM & LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: brian r
Reviews.Content: Just finished staying for six nights. The room had a great view of the bridge of sigh. hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. the location is perfect, close to St. Marks Square and the water buses. Lot's of restaurants and stores right outside hotel. The room was very clean and the breakfast was good. I highly recommend this hotel if you want a hotel in a perfect location in Venice and would stay here again. Brian Ramsay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, large rooms and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: McPaddy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is accessed by its own pontoon if you are taking a taxi boat from the airport which saves pulling luggage through the streets and over bridges which is the norm for Venice. The location of the hotel is fantastic with less than 100m walk to San Marco (St Marks Square). Rooms are very large for central location and although not to my personal taste, done very well in traditional Ventitian style that many others will appreciate. Breakfast is offered in the room or at the sister hotel 30 second walk. Great value for money and definitely will return. Not a hotel for children in my opinion but they do have interconnecting rooms. Staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself doesn't offer a lot of facilities but they are available very close by so don't let this deter you from choosing this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: slmonline
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ponte dei Sospiri for two nights in August - This was our second visit (so we should know better really), the main reason being it's fantastic location, 1 minute from San Marco square and our room literally overlooked the 'bridge of sighs' albeit covered in advertising hoardings as it has been for several years now. Whilst the location is brilliant, and service was very good, the room was unfortunately not, despite being one of the most expensive suites they have. There was no hot water on both mornings we were there so we had cold showers (we told reception, they promised to look into it, but still it was cold), the bed was incredibly uncomfortable with a mattress and frame which desperately needs renewing, the air conditioning worked well but was noisy, the marble floor was chipped in several places so badly that I kept stubbing my foot on the holes... Just generally, for this price, it needs to be a lot better... It is difficult to give only an average review of the hotel, as booking was smooth and easy, location was great, service was great... but the actual hotel room, which is a bit part of what is being paid for, was sadly lacking in several respects... None the less, due to location, we still very much enjoyed our stay overall and Venice is truly wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all costs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ojk2011
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the junior suite for 3 nights at the end of our trip around Italy. In short we were accused of damages to our room and presented with a bill for â‚¬200. Our room was fine but very tired. We did not pay for the damages as they were obviously existing but it ruined our stay. We also had issues with the jets to the jacuzzi bath being broken and suspect wiring to the bedside lamps. AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not at all how it appears”
Reviews.Author: SouthEastSarah
Reviews.Content: We've recently been to venice after a week in lake garda. We really splashed out on this hotel as we were only staying in venice for 2 nights and couldn't wait to get there. After alot of hassle actually getting from peschiera to venice (overall took from 11 o'clock til 6) we FINALLY found the hotel after alot of searching and wrong directions from locals. The only good thing about the hotel is its location, its very close to st. mark's square. However, when we arrived we were shown a very small room, totally dissimilar to the ones advertised on their page. When we complained and showed the the picture of the one shown on our confirmation page, they didn't recognise the picture and admitted that no such room existed in their hotel. We were very annoyed but after so much travelling we hadn't the energy to argue anymore. They still insisted we paid full price and refused to move us to a different room. We were so dissappointed as we had skimmed on spending in lake garda to splash out on this luxurious hotel. Breakfast was in another hotel and we didn't bother getting it the second morning as it was disgusting. I wouldn't recommend this hotel at all, you will not get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm”
Reviews.Author: rsinner
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in August 2010 - we were a couple + a baby. Stayed in a Junior Suite and the deal was pretty good (and included breakfast + one dinner at the hotel's restaurant All' Angelo (drinks not included), free entrance to the casino and a free tour to Murano's shopping area). we ended up using the dinner voucher only. Location: Just off St Marc's square. We took a private water taxi getting there as the distance from the vaporetto stop is about a 5-7 min walk which we could not do with our heavy luggage + baby stroller (more on this later) The room: Huge and beautiful with all the old world Venetian charm. No complaints whatsoever Bathroom: Needs some improvement. It was pretty large but looked worn. For example, the shower curtain was old and stained The view/noise: We did not pay for a canal view room so the window looked into the street below. Because of the narrow street, we could hear sounds till late in the night Food: Breakfast was served in the room and was quite good. The room service is through the All Angelo restaurant just in front of the hotel. The restaurant was amazing. However, the free dinner that we had was from a very limited menu, which was okay, but we would still have wanted more choice. Check out: This is what really made my blood boil. We needed to check around 6:30 ish in the morning for our train. We did not want to spend another 70 odd EUR on the water taxi, but would have done so if the hotel had not given us false assurances. The previous evening we asked if someone from the hotel could take our luggage to the vaporetto stop and we were told it could be done. So we did not book a taxi. But during the check out, we were told that only an authorised/union porter was allowed to carry luggage. We were quite flabbergasted, but anyways decided to carry the luggage on our own to the water taxi station. Apart from the bathroom and the incident at the end, the stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The essence of Venice in this beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline050
Reviews.Content: Four of us arrived at this wonderful hotel by private water taxi which was well worth the extra paid (double the amount of the vaperetto) because it halved the journey time and was a thrilling experience! The hotel did not dissapoint in any way. The location was perfect, only two minutes walk from st Marks square and ten minutes from the Rialto bridge. The room was enchanting and the staff were all so friendly. Breakfast served in the room was an added bonus. Our friend had a birthday whilst we were there and had a cake and message waiting in the room after returning from sightseeing. What a lovely personal touch! We all agreed that this will be the only hotel to stay in when we return to Venice one day. There are some lovely restaurants near to the hotel and the gift shop on the corner sells Murano glass at very competetive prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SSY0202
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to St. Mark's Square. The location could not be better. The room we stayed in looked like it was recently renovated and looked great--from the furniture and doors to the carpeting. The room itself was a bit small, but I assume most hotel rooms are small in Venice. The bathroom was roomy, but the shower stall was very modern, but quite small and awkward for a shower. The staff was friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was served at the sister hotel located practically around the corner. We enjoyed the breakfast, which included hot eggs and bacon besides your standard Italian continental breakfast. One complaint was that our bed was very firm and we could feel the springs underneath the covers. Overall, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but RUDE!”
Reviews.Author: MrsInternational
Reviews.Content: My husband & I checked into this hotel April 29th in the afternoon. I/we were soooo looking forward to our stay here since we splurged a bit for the location and balcony room. After a LONG flight and schlepping our luggage around, we were eager to find some peace. Well, I must say that the Venetians are some of the rudest folks we have encountered! Please do not bother to ask directions in this city. You will be ignored! The only helpful person we ran across was a gondolier, (he knows where his paycheck comes from). Anyways, back to the hotel check in experience. . .we walked in to the lobby, sweaty & tired to a man at a computer totally ignoring us. When he finally did acknowlege our existence he just stared us down. I'm not sure if he just hated tourists in general or what. I have NEVER felt so much hatred come out of a person before! I seriously thought of canceling our plans to stay here because of this man. Actually dreaded coming down the elevator in fear of having to fake "nice-ness". I will say this though, after this man's shift was over, everyone else we had contact with were very pleasant. We had a very nice stay here. Dear Hotel, please do not send me a "glad you contacted us" reply email. Just know that this "gentleman" has the potential to hurt your business. If one can't tolerate the "tourists", then don't work or live in this setting!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not so friendly”
Reviews.Author: robertli1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very close to San Marco square and along a canal, making sightseeing very easy. The hotel upgraded our room from one in the "old hotel" to a suite in the nearby sister hotel, which was nice. My two complaints are that it was very expensive at E330/night and that the staff was rather cold. For example, when we sat in the courtyard after a long day of sightseeing, we were chased away by a surly waiter because the tables were for bar customers only, although all four tables were empty. The front desk staff were not warm either. I would recommend this hotel for a one night stay given its location, but overall I was not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes for us”
Reviews.Author: Verulanium
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at your hotel - the room was gorgeous! Having breakfast served in the room was wonderful and the extensive breakfast menu was very welcome. I particularly want to thank you for the excellent birthday cake you gave me. It was a great surprise and a lovely way to finish the day. We look forward to returning to Venice soon and to staying again in your lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian style and grandeur”
Reviews.Author: Clumsle
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. Put aside the fact that we got engaged while staying here, the rooms are so romantic and scream Venetian opulence. We stayed in two rooms while we were there, both of which were lovely. The first was a blue room, which had stunning high beamed ceilings and a shallow balcony overlooking the bustling ally below. The second was a green room, which was huge and equally stunning with a four-poster bed. This room also had a balcony, but was smaller and looked out over the end of an ally, a canal, and a bridge â€“ so you could see the gondolas as they passed. The breakfasts were served in-room, which was so great â€“ youâ€™re pushing through crowds most of the day, so itâ€™s nice to have a meal in privacy (and one you can eat in your PJâ€™s!). The staff were pleasant enough, and the hotel is located in a really central location to sites and S.Marco square. Iâ€™d definitely recommend staying here and will be keeping this one on my list for future use.

Reviews.Title: “This is wonderful hotel in a great setting.”
Reviews.Author: RLCROBERT
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed spending 2 nights here in the corner Jr. Suite on a canal with views of the Grand Canal beyond the Bridge of Sighs. The room exceeded our expectations for space and grandeur. The entire staff was very pleasant, prompt, helpful and spoke perfect English. The hotel is accessible by private water taxi from the airport, for a price, or take the public water "bus" to the San Marco stop for 26 or so Euro. The stop before San Marco is closer, but you've got to drag your luggage over two bridges. I'd stay here again in a minute as the overall experience was great, in a nice central location. If I had to note one drawback of the room, it's hearing the wheeled luggage being dropped over every step of the nearby bridge in the very early morning. Still worth it....you bet!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: sakss
Reviews.Content: Unfortunatly only stayed for one night at this great hotel. The location is great, one street back from St Marcs Square and surrouded by great restaurants and shops. Room was large and overlooking the canals. The bathroom was very clean, breakfast was included and bought to the room. Average breaky - wouldn't pay for it, but don't pass if included. Easy to get to when arriving by ferry or water taxi, only 5 mins easy walk from the ferry station. (No bridges or stairs to cross with bagage!!)

Reviews.Title: “Could not be happier”
Reviews.Author: DonPeabody_MA
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Venice from Boston with our 16 year-old Grand Daughter. who resides in Indiana. It was a birthday gift and she chose Venice and the Greek Islands as her destination. We offered a trip to "anywhere in the world". We wanted the stay in Venice to be special and it was. This hotel was terrific in every way. My Wife and I have been to Venice before and in Italy we stayed at BIG NAME hotels in the past. This was a smaller and more European hotel. The staff was outstanding not just good, as was the setting and the room. We would never stay anywhere else in Venice after this experience. With hundreds of other choices, we are fortunate to have picked this hotel on-line for this trip.

Reviews.Title: “A magical experience”
Reviews.Author: garyfp
Reviews.Content: We hadn't been to Venice for 25 years and we wanted to make this a memorable occasion for our 30th wedding anniversary. We took heed of what other reviews said and arrived at night time and we weren't disappointed. We splurged on a private water taxi (100 euro) from Marco Polo airport and with a serene view of Venice fast approaching we literally arrived right at our hotel door and mutually agreed that night time was the best time to experience Venice for romance. We stepped off, walked in and were welcomed by Claudio who was informative, polite and gracious. As soon as we entered our Junior Suite we felt like we were entering into a dream world that was beyond words, we opened windows and could hear footsteps of people walking and talking in that "simpatico" Veneto dialect. We decided to go for a walk and take in more of this magical city. It has to be one of the safest cities on the planet, we never felt threatened and of course worried about being hit by cars. We awoke the next day, had a fantastic breakfast and went for 50 meter walk to St Marks Square where after seeing the crowds we quickly realised that we have to share this amazing place with thousands of other tourists like ourselves. We therefore headed to Dosoduro and other areas of Venice to take in the sights and experience the local culture in a more serene fashion.This is a holiday we will never forget!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful Staff, Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: OCAnn
Reviews.Content: We booked a junior suite via Expedia and were extremely pleased with our room (and the rates). I'm a bit OCD about cleanliness and had no issue or problem with the room and restroom. The staff are multi-lingual and helpful. Right on one of the canals, you can arrange for a water taxi (about 100E) to take you to/from Marco Polo/Venice airport directly and the staff can make these arrangements for you. (The staff thoughtfully made arrangements to have a brownbag breakfast for us, since our flight was at 04:30.) The location is conveniently steps away from San Marco piazza. What I loved about the room was that it was decorated with Venetian furniture (and Murano-glass chandelier), but with modern comforts. You'll find a breakfast menu in your room from which you make your selections to place on your doorknob. In the morning, you'll have your simple, yet delicious ("continental plus" with meats & cheeses) breakfast delivered to your room. The only wifi access is with its sister hotel a street or so away; inconvenient, but there if necessary. Their website has accurate photos: http://www.alpontedeisospiri.it/en/rooms-junior-suite.php If you can get a great rate, it's a nice stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location and great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Al_Scotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights last May, and really enjoyed our visit. The location is very central, but we had no problems with noise. The room was big and had a lounge area, 2 massive windows with views over the canals and a decent bathroom. Furnishings were Venetian style and brought lots of character to the rooms. Breakfast is brought to your door on a trolley at whatever time you request! Very clean hotel and staff were helpful. Could find no fault with this hotel, other than there not being any breakfast room (although we enjoyed the room service!) Good value for money. Would recommend this hotel for couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: richa678
Reviews.Content: We stayed in venice in Aug 09 in this hotel in the double room (which is only double room in the entire hotel as rest others are suites). I must say i loved the hotel. I read up reviews of quiet a lot of hotels in venice and after lot of contemplation booked this hotel and it was well worth it. Two three things however. If you expect a lobby and a big entrance et that was not there. It had a lift which take you upstairs to the room. So if you are looking at luxurious lobby etc the hotel is not meant for that. The room on the other hand was excellent. It served our purpose 100%. To stay in a good quality room with a good location and good service. The room furnish decor and quality is very good. The front desk staff is very helpful and very pleasant. They make you feel at home. Breakfast was included in the room price and they delivered it to our room. At night they want you to fill out what you would prefer for breakfast. The main advantage of the hotel is its location. Its very close to St. Mark's Square. We got down at the Ferry Station near St. Mark's Square and could easily locate the hotel. One piece of advice : when visiting venice for first time look for a map and mark the streets carefully as streets get more and more confusing in venice.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: PMdivers
Reviews.Content: It was a joy to relax in our room for an afternoon siesta and after a long day sightseeing. The soft seating and tables and lamps made a lovely romantic setting. The bathroom and huge tub were amazing. We had a junior suite with a Juliette balcony overlooking the Ponte dei Sospiri (bridge of sighs). We had a four poster bed and delicious breakfast brought to the table in our room every morning. It was a luxurious experience. The location is fantastic -- 2 minutes to San Marco and 4 minutes to the Vaporetto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location disappointing staff at times”
Reviews.Author: SantaCruzSteve
Reviews.Content: First, this location is excellent, close to San Marco and easily reached from Vapporetto. My wife and I stayed in a Junior Suite and could not believe how plush, large and comfortable it was. On the other hand my mother in law stayed in a deluxe double and was not impressed. Her shower was tiny and the room was so so. Most of the service was very good however . . . I got an email a week before our stay informing me that they had electrical problems in my canal view room and might need to move me to a non canal view room. That was not really a problem, but when I arrived I was informed that the reason I couldn't have a canal view room was because they were full. They had no idea what I was talking about when I mentioned the electrical problem. Clearly they oversold the canal view rooms and used the electrical problem as an excuse. I don't mind having my reservation changed I just don't like being lied to. Secondly, my mother-in-laws room was very hot and stuffy upon check in. She was told the A/C just needed time. We came back hours later hot and tired and the room was so hot and stuffy it was uninhabitable. They got it fixed within an hour, but should have checked when we first complained. All of that being said I would stay here again, its expensive but very nice. Don't stay in the double deluxe.

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem in venice”
Reviews.Author: bambou13
Reviews.Content: last year in july 2008 , we booked online hotel ponte dei sospiri and we found a wonderful gem in the middle of ''venice''. this year having decided to spend a few days in italy,we booked through booking.com the same hotel.it is still a wonderful gem and the person in charge of the reservation had the very delicate attention to book us in the same room than last time with a courtesy drink waiting for us.i was amazed and felt at home as they remembered us and showed it!!!.expensive?yes of course,like anything in venice, but worth every euro you spend.it is a ''conaisseur's hotel''.will be back surely!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Romantic, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sc-wigan
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from this hotel, where I stayed for 4 nights with my hubby in celebration of our 10th wedding anniversary & his birthday. Whilst in Venice we also renewed our vows. I was impressed by the service of this hotel even before I arrived. I emailed several queries and requests and all were efficiently dealt with, including making dinner reservations etc. Our flight to Venice was delayed by almost 2 and a half hours (Thanks Easyjet, Bristol) so we only arrived at the hotel after midnight. This was not a problem. When we rang to tell them they also assisted in contacting our transfer providers too. Our first day was our vow renewal ceremony. with our breakfast the hotel delivered a celebration mille feuille pastry and a lovely little note. Talking about Brekfasts, these were great. served in your room, at what time you choose (within reason of course, you picked a half hour slot). No cooked breakfast, but I am not a fan of these anyway. If you were canny with your choices however there was enough food to have your breakfast and make up rolls for lunch or have cake for elevenses! Our room (153) was great, very spacious with enough room for a huge canopied bed, wardrobe, drawers, breakfast table & chairs and a sofa. The decoration is traditional venetian and beautifully done, and the chandelier was amazing! We also had a balcony with views of the canal to one side. The bathroom was spacious and whilst the main fittings were new, the bath and shower need some attention (and this is my only gripe). Both were a little tired and the bath leaked when the jet facility was used. All were scrupulously clean though. The staff were attentive and unfailingly polite The location of the hotel is great too. Quiet enough, but central enough. If you are looking for modern blandness then you won't find it here. What you will find is charm, character, luxury and romance. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel just off St Mark's Square !”
Reviews.Author: WelshKitkat
Reviews.Content: Excellent position , charming staff. Our room did not have a canal view (all full), no matter as we were out all day and night anyway. The a/c was adequate, lovely Italienate appointed room (if you like OTT-I do !), gold wardrobes, side tables, huge glass chandelier, richly draped curtains ,bigger than I had anticipated actually, with a very large new bathroom including a bidet. The steam shower was a little on the small side, but in no way was it ever a problem. I love breakfast in bed anyway, so this was a little godsend for me having continental delivered to your room at your appointed time.. Perfect hotel for our first visit to Venice and to see magical Andrea Bocelli in St Mark's Square - soooo romantic.!! Would return in an heartbeat if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ribenia
Reviews.Content: lovely friendly staff, super location and great breakfast. we loved the bathroom and the main room was a bit small but all very clean

Reviews.Title: “Looks are deceiving.....”
Reviews.Author: AmandaCONCETTA
Reviews.Content: When we booked this Hotel, the #1 thing we were looking for was A/C. The Hotel website had said it had A.C.... When we arrived at the Hotel the windows were all open in the 'lobby'...that set an alert off right away. They then showed us to our room and it was HOT AND STUFFY! When we asked the concierge MANUEL if the AC was working all he could say was "Ahhhh, well I don't know??... ha ha ha..you could sleep with the window open?" He said he would have someone come and take a look at it... It wasn't fixed.That night we slept with the windows open, NOT a good idea! The bell tower in St. Mark's Square rang and rang and rang about 100 times! You could also hear the noise from the metal doors opening and closing when the restaurants were closing up. It was HORRIBLE! Also our shower didn't drain properly so our bathroom flooded after a 2min shower! We mentioned that to him and he said he would send someone up right away. He didn't...... we had to go one day with this, the LAST thing we wanted after a day out of walking around in the HOT Venice sun... He was very sneaky and flaky. We didn't care for him at all! DO NOT EAT at the Restuarants the Hotel recommends.... HORRIBLE food!! We ate lunch at a restaurant that was on a corner just down the street from the Hotel, you could kind of see St. Marks Square from the outside seating area. The food was great and staff were very friendly! We even went back for dinner. The Hotel room LOOKED very clean & beautiful with the Murano chandelier.....We ended up with BED BUG BITES the next morning.... Looks are very deceiving!!!! The morning concierge (I dont remember his name) was VERY more helpful and pleasant!! We came back after a few hours and we had SOME type of air flow in the room (not much but it was something) and our shower had been fixed. Whatever you do, DO NOT deal with Manuel. All he could offer us was two complimentary drinks at one of their disgusting restaurants....... We never used them. If you want to go to Murano take the Vaporeto. If you're between the ages of 19 -29 they have discounts on the water taxis passes... so it works out to be a lot cheaper then going through the Hotels service to Murano. Also if you're looking for some sort of night life and dont want to pay an arm and a leg to sit and listen to the Orchestra in St. Marks Square, go to Saint Margarita. You have to get there by the water taxi but it is well worth the local night life. The locals are very friendly and the drinks are very inexpensive. If you want to go on a Gondola ride, I higly recommend doing it at night. The water is calm and peaceful and there aren't any loud motor boats making wakes. It was VERY romantic and worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: buchanan1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated for all amenties and is just two minutes from St marks square. Staff were really courteous and friendly. We up graded to a canel view which whilst we could not see the Bridge of Sighs due to building work was worth the extra money. Breakfast was pleasant and served in your room. All in all a great little hotel that has charm and a greta location.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Elegance”
Reviews.Author: lacey007
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walked in to the marble floored reception to the opening of the door to our "junior suite" we just knew we had picked the right place to stay. We had emailed the hotel direct and arranged our stay. Their emails were courteous and prompt, and the price offered was excellent. Their website is appealing, and the hotel exceeds the photographs. The staff are brilliant at coping with requests, the standards of both the hotel itself and the staff themelves are excellent throught. The furnishings are exquisite, with Venetian chandeliers in all rooms and beautiful drapes. We had asked for, and got, a room with a balcony and a view of the Bridge of Sighs. Our bathroom was to die for! Marble worktops, jacuzzi bath, all sorts of luxuries - marvellous. We were particularly impressed when, because of illness, we had to leave early to come home and we were not charged for the full length of our booking. WE booked for 7 nghts but stayed only for 5, and were charged for 5 - well done to the Hotel on that, although we were prepared to honour our full booking. We did not use the wifi so cannot comment on connectivity, but in every other way the hotel exceeded our expectations. Breakfast is served in the dining area of your room each morning at a pre-arranged time, and is more than sufficient for each person. There was so much food it would not all fit on the table! The location is marvellous, a few seconds to St Marks Square, to the Vaporetto, and the Doges Palace. A short walk to the Rialto. There is plenty to see in the area and Venice felt so safe to wander around all the little alleys and explore in general. There is no restaurant but that does not detract - there is a plethora of restaurants within sight of the hotel so no problem finding somewhere to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome sized room and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LondonRouge
Reviews.Content: Good value for the size and quality of the accomodation, location and breakfast. 2 seconds away from St Marks Square this hotel has very large rooms and a fantastic breakfast room service every morning, it feels the height of luxury having your choice of breakfast delivered and laid out in your room whilst wearing fluffy towels and cosy slippers. On a general note I would recommend ignoring all tourist attractions in preference for simply walking around and following your nose, areas to try: around Academia, Fish and vegetable market, Murano Island, Arsenale and the Ghetto. If your feet start to ache then jump on the ACTV that goes literally all round the island for an amazing perspective (no 41 or 42).

Reviews.Title: “Magical Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: LuluNewJersey_USA
Reviews.Content: This GEM of a hotel has the perfect location-directly behind the Dodges Palace & around the corner from St Marks Square. It is located on a canal and our Jr Suite balcony opened onto the canal and The Bridge of Sighs. The room is furnished with wonderful antique furniture, 4 poster canopied bed, antique dresser, sofa/chairs & topped off with a Murano chandelier, with marble floors. We ate at the restaurant downstairs 2 different nights and the daily Continental Breakfast was enough for 4 people (we were just 2). The location is great-providing quick access to St Marks & the waterbuses/taxi's and is a wonderful base to explore all of Venice, as well as going to the islands of Murano & Burano. Truly a "magical" room to add to the "Magic of Venice". Well worth the price! Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: fuzzy0duck
Reviews.Content: We just returned today from an amazing 2-night stay at the 4* Hotel Al Ponte Dei Sospiri! Although some other reviews say that this hotel is quite difficult to find, it actually is not -- if you take the waterboat and get off at San Marco (the main square in Venice), the hotel is a mere less than 5 minute walk behind the square. The hotel is also a short walk from the landmark Rialto bridge, and is very very near to all the shops - anything from those selling Venetian glass to Gucci and Roberto Cavalli. We arrived early in the morning from Rome all tired, only to be told we would only be able to check in from 2pm onwards as the previous occupants were only checking out at 12pm. So we took a walk around and came back just before 1pm and to our delight, were told that our room was ready! The moment the bellboy opened the room (253) door, we were amazed by what we saw. A lavishly designed Venetian-style room which spelled the word f-a-b-u-l-o-u-s to say the least. It was spacious, with a flat-screen television (the only English channel I found was CNN) and seating area. The bathroom was well-equipped, with a bathtub and heated towel rack. I also suspect that the bathroom and/or its floor is heated too, as the bathroom was always a bit warmer than the bedroom itself. And that meant - no cold toilet seats and stepping on chilly bathroom tiles/marble! The room also comes with a complimentary turn-down service. It was nice to come back to a room with the curtains closed, ambient soft lights switched on, some sweets and a slip of paper with the weather forecast for tomorrow! But the best was yet to come - breakfast served in the room the next morning! Every evening you indicate what you want for breakfast and the time you want it delivered, hang it outside your door and wait for it to be served the next morning. No more rushing down to the coffee house and jostling with other guests for a buffet spread! The staff in the hotel were also very accommodating and helpful (that says a lot because I found most Italians generally rather unfriendly), so that was a welcome break from the norm! There is no wireless access in this hotel but you are allowed to access the wireless network of their sister establishment,the Dona Palace Hotel, which is just opposite. All in all, this has to be the best stay I've had in a hotel and although I only left this morning I am dreaming of coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Al Ponte Dei Sospiri”
Reviews.Author: fatcat40
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely wonderful stay at the Al Ponte Dei Sospiri Hotel, fabulous location only a couple of minutes walk from St Marks Square, Junior Suite (No. 153) was excellent and finished to a very high standard and spacious. Breakfast served in the room was lovely and set you up for the day. And finally, the staff were brilliant, so all in all highly recommended and will definately stay here again. Thank you..!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! (hospitality and location)”
Reviews.Author: rachelroma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed in this hotel (which is actually 4 stars, not 3 as shown). It turned out to be an amazing value for the price and we will definitely stay there again. For 270 euros on a Friday night we were given a room with quite a long balcony, a whirlpool tub, sitting area, and served breakfast in our room, not to mention being just steps for St Marc's square. The location of this hotel is just perfect on a quiet street and canal with easy access to all of the best sites in Venice. The hotel staff were very courteous and always greeted us by name. They were just as comfortable speaking English with me as they were speaking Italian with my husband. I would classify the breakfast as continental plus. We had the typical continental breakfast of bread and jam, tea, etc, plus sliced ham and soft cheese. We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anon091
Reviews.Content: We (my husband & I) have just spent 4 nights at this lovely hotel. Its location is very close to St Mark's Square - easy to pop back to for a rest before getting back to the excitement of San Marco. The decor of the room was elegant & sumptious - surrounding us with the grand feeling of Venice. It was very clean and towels etc. were changed daily. The shower was not the best as it was handheld and as we never have baths (preferring to shower) the spa bath was wasted on us. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times, even bringing breakfast to the room half an hour before it 's usually served so we could eat before leaving for an early flight. Having breakfast in the room every morning was fantastic (no rushing to be up and dressed to get to a dining room) it makes a leisurely start to a busy day exploring Venice. The daily weather report left in the room with a handful of sweets the evening before was generally accurate, and a nice touch. Disappointed not to have seen the Bridge of Sighs - it was shrouded in scaffolding and covers and only visible from the other side - but that was nothing to do with the Hotel. The ongoing building work opposite didn't really bother us because we were around the corner overlooking the Calle, it was great looking down into the street, people watching the passersby on their way to and from the glass factory over the bridge on the other side of the canal. We had a wonderful time in Venice, made more special by staying in this hotel. I would definitely recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't beat this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sassb12
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel - excellent location just around the corner from St Mark's square. Having stayed at our fair share of good and bad hotels, I was a bit worried and researched this one on trip advisor first. I can honestly say we had no complaints whatsoever (and we are fussy!). It was our first anniversary and was lovely each morning to have breakfast in our room. No it is not a full fatty English fry up, but my husband (who likes his food) managed to eat plenty. The furnishing were fabulous, very ornate. We had a jacuzzi bath too in room 151 which was fun. The rooms were spotlessly clean and the staff couldn't do enough to please. Venice is VERY expensive though. You are charged just for your seat in most restaurants, so look around, there are many with no charge - others charge up to 5 euro per person!!! We went for 4 nights, which was fantastic, but you don't need 4 nights there. Venice is quite small, and you can only do so much walking! Overall, a wonderful place to go, and a superb hotel too. Just save your pennies for the cafes and restaurants first!!

Reviews.Title: “What an Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: thestonna
Reviews.Content: We were due to stay at the Hotel Dona which turned out to be the sister hotel of the Hotel al Ponte dei Sospiri. We were staying just one night over the the Redatore Festival weekend and to also celebrate our wedding anniversary. On arrival they upgraded our room to a junior suite in the Hotel al Ponte dei Sospiri which was just round the corner from the hotel Dona. The Ponte dei Sospiri only had a small number of rooms and breakfast was served in the room which was brilliant. The room was well furnished and had a power and steam shower which was great. LCD TV on the wall and bathrobes and slippers, all the extras you would expect from a top hotel. The location is on the same cannal as the bridge of Sighs and is very close to St Marks Square. For a romantic stay with a great location this was great.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Lisa2327
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights from 16th June 2008. The reception staff couldn't have been more helpful, giving us maps, suggestions of sights to visit and restaurants to try. The room (151) was a great size with a separate sitting area with sofa, 2 chairs and table. The room was nicely decorated with drapes above the bed. There was more than enough room and storage etc. The bathroom was also large with a jacuzzi bath (that didn't exactly work!) and shower. The location is perfect, right on the canal behind St Mark's square, down a small side street (on arrival, go into the square, take the street to the left of the basilica turn left before the canal and 1st right and the entrance is by the bridge - only a minute's walk). One piece of advice i would offer is don't eat or drink in the restaurants around the hotel & square, it's extortionately expensive, we ordered 2 drinks and 2 small pizzas and paid over Â£40! There are far better places a couple of minutes walk away from the hotel. Breakfast is excellent if you enjoy continental breakfasts. Don't expect bacon and eggs, it's breads, toast, croissants, pastries, muffins, jams, ham, cheese, salami etc or cereals plus juices and hot drinks too. Overall we really rated this hotel, excellent value for money in a very expensive city and the location couldn't have been better. If you're after a comfortable, quiet stay in venice, this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good view of Bridge of Sighs”
Reviews.Author: DevonTutor
Reviews.Content: Over rated and over priced is how I rate this hotel. View of Bridge of Sighs was great if you looked down the canal....but definitely not worth 400 euros per night..directly opposite our room was a scaffold clad building which wasn't the "view" I thought we'd have. Breakfast was very disappointing......menu choice was so repetitive...no variation what so ever...cereal was cornflakes....fruit salad was the tinned variety....yoghurt was cheap watery variety.....rolls were never fresh....we ordered toast every day but never received it until I made a complaint to the front desk ,when it appeared on the final morning of our 4 day stay I wish it hadn't....the bread was thin sliced white from a supermarket.........when Italy bakes such delicious breads..not 4* hotel standard. The bar was never open.if we wanted a coffee in the evening we had to go to the sister hotel..O.K. if fine but not so good in a Venice deluge!! Many bathroom fittings were in need of repair...the shower curtain was tatty and water pressure so bad it actually took an hour to fill the bath!!! When we arrived the soap dish in the bathroom had a new tablet of soap placed in a dish still soapy from the previous occupants and which had also been used as an ashtray........despite immediately complaining nothing was done to replace it until I deposited it on the front desk the following day when we arrived back in the evening to find it still in the bathroom. We were very disappointed as this was a special anniversay break which was the reason we chose this hotel........we are frequent visitors to Venice and wish we had chosen to stay at our regular hotel which despite being rated only 3 stars is far superior for food and facilities

Reviews.Title: “luxurious”
Reviews.Author: vagabond1972
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location...easy to get to. Very lovely and nice room, it is very pricey (as with most of Venice) but you get what you pay for. Directions provided by the hotel were great - take the Vaporetto #82 (waterbus) from the train station, takes you to Piazza San Marco, cross the square and it is on the left. The building across from the hotel did have scaffolding - but this did not at all bother us nor obstruct any views. Our balcony was very spacious, over looking a canal to the right and shops to the left below. It was so nice to walk out of the hotel, turn the corner and be at St. Mark's Square. Venice is a dream...and intriguing. My only regret is having a short stay. Definitely recommend at least 2 nights. Ponte Rialto is nearby - short 10 minute walk. I had booked a triple room - a double/queen bed and sofa bed. Murano chandelier on the ceiling, finely crafted woodwork/furniture and a very nice bathroom (large shower head and jacuzzi tub). Breakfast of your choice is included and served to your room - very delicious. If you are looking to splurge a bit for a short stay in Venice (it is rather expensive) with convenient location in mind, I would definitely recommend this hotel. FYI - many shops close rather early in the area, but the various musicians come nightfall in the square makes up for it. Unfortunately my photos of the hotel doesn't do it justice.

Reviews.Title: “great location pity about the rest”
Reviews.Author: aintree_7
Reviews.Content: booked for our wedding anniversary. hotel was in great location the best room in the hotel was on the second floor overlooking the bridge of sighs it cost an extra 100 euros per night. If I had been in any other room I would have been even more disappointed than I was. the hot water came out of the tap so slow it took over an hour to fill the jaccuzi bath that did not work properly anyway. the shower was like a trickle it took forever to try and wash the shampoo out of your hair it was that weak. We did complain but was told it was the water pressure in venice but the cold water worked fine and the hot taps seemed to work fine everywhere else. The room was dark and tired and very noisy. there is no bar or restaraunt in the hotel so we were served breakfast in our room each morning we stopped after two days as the bread, toast and croissants were that stale. there is a lot of building work going on right opposite the hotel I did question this before I left as I had read about it on trip advisor but they e-mailed me and confirmed that the building work had finished in May 2007 which was a lie. the workmen the generators the noise starts between 7-8a.m each day. Some of the staff were helpful the others were not I would not stay there again and would not reccomend it to friends or family. Was expensive for what it was

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - shame about the view”
Reviews.Author: RVG16
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked to stay at this hotel due to it's fantastic location and promised views. It is not a cheap hotel and after looking on the hotel website amonst others, we booked suite 101; the Ducale Room which commanded an additional cost to guarantee availability due to it's location in the hotel and views from it's balcony. The hotel did not disappoint in terms of it's location and the room itself was fantastic. However, the scaffolding we had expected on the building on the opposite side of the canal was made worse by additional scaffolding on the building next door to the hotel, completely blocking all light and view from our balcony! The sound of building work all day long was made worse by the fact that the new scaffolding had created a tunnel for the busy pathway bellow which our balcony was at the end of, channelling all of the echoing sound directly into our room. We can only imaging how wonderful the room could have been. Thankfully, the hotel's management decided not to charge us the additional cost per night for this room we had originally agreed to pay but it would have been nice to have been warned of the situation prior to arrival. Other than the building work taking place around the hotel's immediate location, I would thoroughly recommend staying in this hotel and will return when hopefully it will all be completed!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel, but BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: jefferyrowland
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise trip for my wife for our 20th anniversary, so I booked a room "with a view" for the occasion about 6 months in advance of the event. I ended up inviting our friends and some family as well (also a surprise). Our friends booked much closer to the event date, so there was a significant difference in our rates. Not a big deal, as I wanted to ensure availability, so I understood that. We loved the hotel, and the hotel also did some very nice, special request things for me for the occasion at my request (for a price); however, here is the thing that did (and still does) bother me. Outside of my room, the building across the canal and outside our windows was covered in scaffolding which was absolutely a total unsightly mess. My dissapoint was that I was paying a premium for "A room with a view". When I brought the situation to the hotel's attention, I was told that it was not the hotel's fault that the construction was taking place. I told the hotel staff (they would not let me talk directly to anyone higher than the desk manager) that I was paying extra for a room with a view that did not exist, and that the price should be adjusted. I got the email address of the hotel ownership and general manager with whom I corresponded accordingly. I was not able to get any kind of adjustment for this situation, nor would the hotel staff give me the courtesy of any coorespondence after I checked out. Combine that with the fact that at 7:00 AM promptly every morning, the workers began hammering all day until at least 17:00 every day, I was dissapointed to say the least that the hotel management did not place more importance on me as a customer. Again, I absolutely loved the hotel, but clearly if you don't specifically ask, you may pay a premium for a view that you may not normally be willing to pay a premium for.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: crocodilehunters
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights in Venice - staying at Al Ponte Dei Sospiri. What can I say - fantastic place and woud highly recommend it. We stayed in the Ducale Room (101) and were not disappointed. Spent our breakfast mornings, looking out onto the canal and soaking up the atmosphere. It is only a minute or so from the Square - Tip: if you don't like crowds and want to enjoy the squre all by yourself, go either very early or late in the evening. The guys on reception are extremely organised and friendly (without being over friendly) - we organised water taxis through them (only 50 euros to Airport) and had no problems at all. This is not a cheap Hotel (but Venice is not a cheap place). However, is has an amazing atmosphere - a real place to see. Stay at the Hotel Ponte dei Sospiri - it was fantastic and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: mcasscanada
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop in our Italy honeymoon. We stayed for 6 wonderful days. The hotel was a bit hard to find, but worth it! Near the center of all the action, but off to the side so its a bit quieter. The in-room breakfast was unbelieveable. It was more food in one morning that we were offered for breakfast during the rest of our 3 weeks in Italy combined! And after all our walking, the marble bathroom and soaker tub were a real treat. Acton, ON, Canada

Reviews.Title: “A place to remember.”
Reviews.Author: JaviCAP
Reviews.Content: My wife, my two months old son and me stayed on this hotel from August 14th to 18th. What can I say about this gem just around the basilica di San Marco and with views to the rio della Canonica and the Bridge of Sights itself? This hotel has just 8 rooms, all junior suites, and we were at the Ducale (room 101). Incredible suite of about 35-40 squared metres, with four posters king size bed, enormous Murano spider, brocades here and there, tapestry, 5 metres high ceilings with exposed beams, jacuzzi tub, four windows and a balcony from where you can see the canal della Canonica and the bridge of sights. Sadly, the fondamenta is on heavy repairs, and the wiev was very poor on the bridge, you could see just the top volutes. The breakfast was served at your room at the time you choose (from 8 am to 10:30 am). You get a card everyday, and the night before choose what you want to eat, and the next morning is served on your suite by a waitress. We arrived on my birthday, and our room there was a bottle of prosecco and two cups waiting for us. This hotel belongs to the same owners of the DonÃ¡ Palace and Al'Angelo hotels and the Al'Angelo, La Canonica and La Grotta restaurants, so you can use the services of the DonÃ¡ Palace (20 metres away) as bar, terrace, etc. This hotels have their own water taxi, and they offer very competitive rates: 50 euros for the three of us plus luggage from the hotel to the airport. The situation is wonderful for me, just 70 metres away from Piazza San Marco, in the middle of the rush that I love, but many people can find it too busy. This is the first hotel in Venice where I'd like to come back, and have known a few of them before. One more thing: the hotel is marked as a four stars hotel, but don't know how they've got it. For me, this hotel is a "pensione" developed to the "extra deluxe" rank, but it has no common places, nor bar or restaurant. On the other hand, it has a very good lift and a private pier, so you can reach the hotel directly from your water taxi, with nno need to carry your luggage. The concierges were helpful and very good natured, but a bit distant, that for me is a good point, don't like these clerks who seem to know you from 10 years ago. Hope to be back very soon.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel al Ponte dei Sospiri
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Larga San Marco 381, 30124 Venice, Italy
